title: Flood warnings for parts of Qld, NSW as heavy rainfall moves east | ABC NEWS
description: Flood watches have been issued for more than a dozen rivers in Queensland and New South Wales as heavy rainfall is forecast to persist through the weekend. ABC Meteorologist Tom Saunders walks through the areas that should see the most impact. title: Trump revokes Obama-era climate regulation in the US | ABC NEWS
description: The Trump administration has reversed a key Obama-era ruling that curbed greenhouse gas emissions in cars and trucks. Donald Trump called the move "the single largest deregulatory action in American history". Michael Gerrard, Director of the Sabin Centre for Climate Change Law at Columbia University, says it is a step in the wrong direction in the fight against climate change. Gerrard predicts the bill will be challenged in the US Court of Appeals. title: How hard could asking a world-famous politican one question be? | ABC NEWS
description: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party has won the nation's first vote since the deadly student-led uprising in 2024. Party chairman Tarique Rahman is set to become the country's next prime minister after his party secured more than half of the parliament's seats. title: Ley's resignation leaves Taylor with immediate 'messy' by-election: Casey Briggs | ABC NEWS
description: Outgoing Liberal leader Sussan Ley has announced her retirement from politics after the appointment of Angus Taylor as the party's new leader. Chief Elections Analyst Casey Briggs says Ley's resignation has left an immediate electoral test for Taylor's leadership, with her NSW seat of Farrer now vacant to a likely challenge from Coalition candidates. title: Aussie dollar set to keep climbing, says ANZ | The Business | ABC NEWS
description: Despite the risk off mood at the end of the week, the Australian dollar is still up six per cent against the greenback in 2026 so far. ANZ head of FX research, Mahjabeen Zaman, says the interest rate differential between the United States and Australia is just one factor driving the currency higher. She expects it to hit 73 US cents by the end of 2026. She also discusses the strong performance of the Aussie against the NZ dollar and Japanese yen. Alicia Barry also asked the boss of the Commonwealth Bank, Matt Comyn, about his view on the potential of AI to reshape the economy.   Australia Post also wants to increase the price of a standard stamp to $1.85. The share market managed to close two per cent higher for the week. This segment is presented by Alicia Barry. #ABCBusiness  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Angus Taylor wins Liberal leadership after bruising party room battle | ABC NEWS
description: Angus Taylor has won the Liberal leadership, comfortably defeating Sussan Ley in a party room showdown. The party's first female leader, ousted after just nine months in the top job, is stepping down from politics altogether. The move will set up the first big test for her successor â€” fighting a by-election. National Affairs correspondent Jane Norman reports. title: Police drone captures moments after $10m cannabis crop raid in Victoria | ABC NEWS
description: Police are investigating whether a $10 million cannabis crop found in regional Victoria is connected to organised crime. Five workers fled, and three of them swam across an irrigation channel to escape. Four men were captured and have been charged with cultivating a commercial amount of cannabis.
